ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Wait, so are you IN that fancy schmancy guild? ... From:	Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas) [mailto:garramone@lvcablemodem.com] Sent:	Thursday, May 11, 2000
ygData.messageBody:
Wait, so are you IN that fancy schmancy guild?

-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:garramone@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 11, 2000 1:07 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)

i can understand that. i would say almost all of the
players that did leave
a guild and join the new one were not caught off guard.
they were aware
this new guild was being formed and its purpose, and were
planning on
joining anyway.

Shada


> > If you ask someone in a different guild if they want to
join
> > yours, IMHO,
> > you ARE stealing players from that other guild. If they
are
> > not currently
> > IN a guild and/or ask you if they can join your guild,
then
> you aren't
> > stealing, it was their choice.
>
> It's their choice anyway. But I think the best thing to
do
> would have the
> leader of the guild looking to recruit contact the leader
of
> the players
> current guild and let them know what they're doing and
why.
>
> Peace
> Evulia, bard of 10 songs, Tunare
